intro: Psychotria humboldtiana var. caudata, commonly known as the Humboldt's Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests. Its botanical significance lies in its potential medicinal properties and its role in ecological systems.
